RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the pickup truck: Maria De Jesus Garcia’s pickup truck

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia\u2019s pickup truc: Vehicle used in the transportation of undocumented aliens, stopped by border patrol for immigration inspection, and subject to a suppression motion regarding evidence obtained from the stop and search. Exhibited signs of heavy loading, including squashed tires and angled headlights, and was driven at a slow speed. Involved in an appeal case where the defendant alleges an unconstitutional stop and search. Subject of a suppression motion to exclude evidence obtained during the stop. Stopped more than 100 miles from the United States-Mexican border. Came from the United States-Mexican border area. Occupants were unwashed, unkempt, and attempted to evade detection. Raised suspicion due to its unusually heavy and overloaded appearance, fogged windows, and slow speed. Carried three women in the front seat of the truck cab and five or six men in the back seat of the truck. Stopped on an interstate highway in Texas 115 miles north of the United States-Mexican border. Occupants were moving and slouching low to avoid detection by border patrol agents. Occupants' actions included ducking, scrambling, slouching, and hunkering down in response to being observed by Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron. Passengers attempted to conceal themselves when a flashlight was shone into the cab. Occupants were scrambling around trying to get lower than the windows to avoid detection. The vehicle was traveling at forty to forty-five miles per hour, which was unusual for that portion of Interstate Highway 35.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.marked border patrol sedan: Border Patrol vehicle used for surveillance and observation, driven by agents during the stop of Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup truck camper: Vehicle suspected of transporting living beings, possibly people, due to fogged windows and heavy loading; found to be carrying multiple undocumented aliens, and subject to a search. Frequently used for transporting illegal aliens. Was heavily loaded when stopped. The camper shell had fogged windows indicating the presence of breathing cargo.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup truck camper and Maria De Jesus G: Vehicles involved in the transportation of smuggled persons, with the pickup truck camper being frequently used for such activities
